title: A Case of Widespread Pain: Fibromyalgia in a Middle-Aged Woman
clinical_history: Sarah is a 45-year-old marketing manager who presents with a 3-year history of widespread musculoskeletal pain. She reports that the pain started gradually, with no specific incident or trauma, and has been persistent and debilitating. She describes the pain as aching, stiffness, and soreness in multiple areas of her body, which has affected her daily activities and sleep patterns.

nprs.affected_area: Multiple areas including neck, shoulders, back, hips, and legs
Localized pain in lower back and hips

aggrevating_factors: Prolonged physical activity, stress, and lack of sleep
picture: A 24-hour pain pattern showing increased pain in the morning and evening
easing_factors: Gentle exercise, warm baths, and relaxation techniques
past_history: History of irritable bowel syndrome and migraines
personal_history: Married with two children, works full-time, and reports high levels of stress
imaging: None, as her condition is primarily diagnosed clinically
